intro: Steiroglossa lineariloba, commonly known as the narrow-lobed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is well adapted to dry, coastal climates. Steiroglossa lineariloba is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
